INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the verapamil be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours distant from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring.

For verapamil by mouth:
--risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older persons
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --the verapamil via IV

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering medication. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be undertaken under strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin (decrease of its hepatic metabolism), and increase of the risk of gum disorders.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to increase of its plasma concentrations by the verapamil
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose, or even 75 mg/day in case of moderate renal insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident.

Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extrarenal elimination of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG and, possibly, testing of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the verapamil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the doxorubicin due to increase of its plasma concentrations

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment by the calcium channel blocker with the lowest recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the verapamil.
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of alteration of the left ventricular function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the length of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam (decrease of its hepatic metabolism with increase of sedation).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of midazolam during the treatment with the verapamil.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large reduction of the concentrations of verapamil, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the nintedanib due to increase of it absorption by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of olaparib by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, limit the dose of olaparib to 200 mg twice a day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of verapamil, with risk of the appearance of undesirable effects
Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the sirolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir alafenamide due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of co-administration with the verapamil, the dose of tenofovir alafenamide must be limited to 10mg per day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
